pageContext.description: Fragment of blade of a small ogival dagger. Although the shoulders, edges and point are all broken, its original outline is indicated by the grooves running down the blade near the edges.
pageContext.surface: One side fairly smooth, with a few small pits near the point: the other side has large areas of the surface broken away, the depression then formed being covered with patches of green patina.
pageContext.associations: In the barrow were bones and an amber pommel with minute gold studs let into it.
pageContext.site: England,Devon,Hammeldon Down on Dartmoor. The furthermost of the "Two Barrows". Exact find place in barrow is not known (1872).
